TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/ Click the “continue” button to start the experiment.
For getting the process of transfection, click on the transfection button. Otherwise you continue with western blotting button.
notext
The CO[sub]2[/sub] incubator is opened and T labeled plate (test plate) is taken from it. After that the incubator is closed.
T labeled plate is placed on the work bench and is opened.
The plate is tilted for sucking out the entire medium from the plate using a pipette tip which is attached to a vacuum pump.
2ml pipette is taken from the rack and a pipette pump is attached to it.
2ml pipette is taken from the rack and a pipette pump is attached to it.
A bottle containing PBS is opened and 2ml of solution is pipetted out. After that the bottle is closed.
The solution is poured into the plate for washing.
The solution is mixed well.
The plate is tilted for sucking out the entire medium from the plate using a pipette tip which is attached to a vacuum pump. After that the plate is closed.
A 20-200 microliter pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 150 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
A tube containing10% SDS buffer is taken from the rack and is opened. Then 150 microliters of solution is pipetted out from it. After that the tube is closed.
The T labeled plate is opened and taken from the work bench.
The solution is poured into the plate for washing and shake it well.
A sterile cell scraper is taken from the beaker.
The cells are scraped from the bottom of the plate and shift them into a corner of the plate.
A 20-200 micro liter pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 150 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The lysate is pipetted out from the plate.
The plate is replaced into the work bench and is closed.
A T labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T labeled microfuge tube is opened and the lysate is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The CO[sub]2[/sub] incubator is opened and another C labeled plate (control plate) is taken from it. After that the incubator is closed.
C labeled plate is placed on the work bench and it is opened.
The plate is tilted for sucking out the entire medium from the plate using a pipette tip which is attached to a vacuum pump.
2ml pipette is taken from the rack and a pipette pump is attached to it.
2ml pipette is taken from the rack and a pipette pump is attached to it.
A bottle containing PBS is opened and 2ml of solution is pipetted out. After that the bottle closed.
The solution is poured into the plate for washing
The plate is mixed well.
The plate is tilted for sucking out the entire medium from the plate using a pipette tip which is attached to a vacuum pump. After that the plate is closed.
A 20-200 microliter pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 150 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
A tube containing10% SDS buffer is taken from the rack and is opened. Then 150 microliters of solution is pipetted out from it. After that the tube is closed.
The C labeled plate is opened and is taken from the work bench.
The solution is poured into the plate for washing and shake it well.
A sterile cell scraper is taken from the beaker.
The cells are scraped from the bottom of the plate and shift them into a corner of the plate.
A 20-200 microliter pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 150 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The lysate is pipetted out from the plate.
The plate is replaced into the work bench and is closed.
A C labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C labeled microfuge is opened and the lysate is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C labeled microfuge is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The samples are incubated for 5 minutes at room temperature.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
The microfuge tubes labeled as T and C are taken from the rack.
Both the Microfuge tubes are placed into the refrigerated centrifuge.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is closed.
The rpm is adjusted to 14,000 for 15 minutes at 25ºC.
After that the refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
Both the microfuge tubes are taken from the refrigerated centrifuge.
Both the microfuge tubes are placed into the rack.
A 20-2000 pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 150 micro liters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The C labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C labeled microfuge tube is opened and the supernatant is taken from it. After that the tube is closed.
The C labeled microfuge tube is replaced and C1 labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 labeled microfuge tube is opened and the supernatant is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 labeled microfuge is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The T labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T labeled microfuge tube is opened and the supernatant is taken from it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T labeled microfuge tube is replaced and T1 labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is opened and the supernatant is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack. After that both the microfuge tubes T1 and C1 containing rack is taken
The -20ºC freezer is opened and both microfuge tubes are kept inside it for storage. After that the door is closed.
To estimate the amount of protein, click on the first button and to confirm the presence of protein, click on the second button.
The -20ºC freezer is opened and both microfuge tubes along with rack are taken from it. After that the door is closed.
Both the microfuge tubes along with rack are placed into the work bench and kept for 5 minute at room temperature.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack and mixed it well. Similarly C1 labeled microfuge tube is taken and mixed it well.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
The microfuge tubes labeled as T1 and C1 are taken from the rack.
Both the Microfuge tubes are placed into the refrigerated centrifuge.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is closed.
The rpm is adjusted to 10,000 for 1 minute.
After that the refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
Both the microfuge tubes are taken from the refrigerated centrifuge.
Both the microfuge tubes are placed into the rack.
notext
A 0.5-10 microliters pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 7.5 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The C1 labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 labeled microfuge tube is opened and 7.5 micro liters of control sample is taken from it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 labeled microfuge tube is replaced and C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened and the control sample is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is adjusted to 4.5 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
A bottle containing sterile Milli-Q water is opened and 4.5 microliters of solution is pipetted out. After that the bottle closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened and the 4.5 microliters of Milli-Q water is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is adjusted to 4 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The sample buffer containing vial is taken from the rack.
The sample buffer containing vial is opened and 4 microliters of sample buffer is pipette out. After that the vial is closed.
The sample buffer containing vial is replaced into the rack.
The C1+b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened. Then 4 microliters of sample buffer is transferred and mixed into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is adjusted to 7 micro liters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is opened and 7 microliters of test sample is taken from it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 labeled microfuge tube is replaced and T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened. Then test sample is transferred and mixed into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is adjusted to 5 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
A bottle containing sterile Milli-Q water is opened and 4.5 microliters of solution is pipetted out. After that the bottle closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened and the 5 microliters of Milli-Q water is transferred into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is adjusted to 4 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
sample buffer containing vial is taken from the rack.
The sample buffer containing vial is opened and 4 microliters of sample buffer is pipette out. After that the vial is closed.
The sample buffer containing vial is replaced into the rack.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened. Then 4 microliters of sample buffer is transferred and mixed into it. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The centrifuge door is opened.
The microfuge tubes labeled as T1 +b and C1 +b are taken from the rack.
Both the Microfuge tubes are placed into the centrifuge.
The centrifuge door is closed.
The rpm is adjusted to 10,000 for 1 minute.
After that the refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
Both the microfuge tubes are taken from the centrifuge.
Both the microfuge tubes are placed into the dry bath incubator for 5 minutes.
Both the microfuge tubes are taken from the dry bath incubator.
Both the microfuge tubes are placed into the rack.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
The microfuge tubes labeled as T1 +b and C1 +b along with rack are taken.
Both the Microfuge tubes are placed into the refrigerated centrifuge.
The refrigerated centrifuge door is closed.
The rpm is adjusted to 12,000 for 10 minutes.
After that the refrigerated centrifuge door is opened.
Both the microfuge tubes are taken from the refrigerated centrifuge.
Both the microfuge tubes are placed into the rack.
A bottle containing running buffer is taken.
The bottle containing running buffer solution is poured into the SDS -PAGE apparatus having gel in it. After the bottle is closed.
A 0.5-10 microliters pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 10 microliters.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened and 10 microliters of control sample is pipetted out. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The C1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The control sample is loaded into the second well of the gel.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is taken from the rack.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is opened and 10 microliters of control sample is pipetted out. After that the microfuge tube is closed.
The T1 +b labeled microfuge tube is replaced into the rack.
The test sample is loaded into the third well of the gel.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The vial containing pre stained marker is taken from the rack.
The vial containing pre stained marker is opened and 10 microliters of marker is pipetted out. After that the vial is closed.
The vial is replaced into the rack.
The marker is loaded into the first well of the gel.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
The lid of the SDS-PAGE apparatus is closed.
The voltage is adjusted to 200 V.
The gel is allowed to run for 45 minutes. After that it is stopped.
Click on the button, “Membrane transfer”.
The -4ºC freezer is opened.
A bottle containing transfer buffer is taken from the 4ºC refrigerator. After that the 4ºC refrigerator door is closed.
A bottle containing transfer buffer is placed into the work bench and is opened to take the buffer from it.
The lid of the tray is removed and the transfer buffer is poured into each trays.
The bottle containing transfer buffer is replaced into the work bench and closed it.
The lid of the SDS-PAGE apparatus is removed and the gel holder is taken.
The gel holder clip is removed and the gel cassette having gel is taken from the gel holder.
The top glass is removed from the gel cassette using a scoop.
The gel is transferred into the transfer buffer containg tray.
All the materials need for membrane transfer is arranged in front of the transfer buffer containing tray.
A bottle containing methanol is opened and taken from the work bench.
The methanol is poured into the fresh tray.
A bottle containing methanol is replaced into the work bench and closed it.
The PVDF membrane is taken from the work bench.
The upper coating layer of the membrane is peel off from the PVDF membrane and the PVDF membrane is taken.
The PVDF membrane is transfer into the methanol containg tray and incubates the membrane for 2 minutes at room temperature.

The PVDF membrane is taken from the methanol containing tray and placed into the cold transfer buffer containing tray. After that the PVDF membrane is incubated for 10 minutes in cold transfer buffer.
The cassette is taken and opened it.
The cassette is placed into the cold transfer buffer containing tray. The black side of the cassette is immersed into the buffer.
The sponge is taken and placed above the black side of the cassette.
The sponge is taken and placed above the black side of the cassette.
The filter paper is taken and placed above the sponge in the cassette.
The filter paper is taken and placed above the sponge in the cassette.
Another glass is removed from the gel containing tray.
The gel is taken from the tray and placed above the filter paper in the cassette using a scoop.
The gel is properly placed above the filter paper in the cassette.
The PVDF membrane is taken from the tray and placed above the gel in the cassette using a forceps.
The blotting roller is taken from the work bench and gently rolls out above the surface of the PVDF membrane. After that the roller is replaced into the work bench.
The filter paper is taken and placed above the PVDF membrane in the cassette.
The filter paper is taken and placed above the PVDF membrane in the cassette.
The sponge is taken and placed above the filter paper in the cassette.
The sponge is taken and placed above the filter paper in the cassette.
The blotting roller is taken from the work bench and gently rolls out above the surface of the sponge. After that the roller is replaced into the work bench.
The cassette is taken from the tray.
The cassette is locked.
The cassette is placed inside the transfer apparatus.
The ice box is taken and placed inside the tank.
A bottle containing transfer buffer is taken.
The bottle containing transfer buffer solution is poured into the transfer apparatus. After that the bottle is closed.
The lid of the transfer apparatus is closed.
The voltage is adjusted to 100 V.
The gel is allowed to run for 120 minutes. After that it is stopped.
Click on the button, “Immunoblotting”.
The lid of the transfer apparatus is opened and is placed in the work bench.
The cassette is taken from the transfer apparatus.
The cassette is opened and is kept on the work bench.
The sponge and the filter paper are removed using forceps. Then the PVDF membrane is transfer into a tray with the same forceps.
The DDH[sub]2[/sub]O bottle is opened and is taken from the work bench.
The DDH[sub]2[/sub]O is poured into the tray at a level in which the PVDF membrane should be submerged in it.
The bottle is kept back to the work bench and is closed.
The tray is taken from the work bench and is swirled.
The solution is discarded into the waste beaker by tilting the tray and the tray is kept back to the work bench.
The Ponceau stain containing bottle is taken from the rack.
The Ponceau stain containing tray is opened and is transfer into a fresh tray. After that the tube is closed.
The Ponceau stain containing tray is kept back to the rack.
The tray Ponceau stain is taken from the work bench and is swirled for the uniform distribution of the stain.
Then the PVDF membrane is transferred to the Ponceau stain containing tray using forceps.
The tray is swirled to sink the membrane fully in the stain and the tray is closed.
The tray is placed on the shaking platform and is shaken for 1 hour.
After 1 hour the tray is opened and is taken from the shaking plat form.
After 1 hour the tray is opened and is taken from the shaking plat form.
The tray containing Ponceau stain is discarded into a waste beaker. Then the membrane is distained by pouring water into the tray.
The water is discarded into the waste beaker. The water is again added into the waste beaker and the water is removed into the waste beaker.
The solution is discarded into the waste beaker.
The tray containing PVDF membrane is kept back to the work bench.
The tray containing PVDF membrane after washing.
A bottle containing 5% non – fat dry milk in TBST buffer is opened and is taken from the work bench.
5% non – fat dry milk in TBST buffer is transferred into the membrane containing tray.
5% non – fat dry milk in TBST buffer is kept back to the table and the bottle is closed.
The tray is closed
The tray is taken from the work bench.
The tray is placed on the shaking plat form and is shaken for 1 hour.
notext
After 1 hour the tray is opened and is taken from the shaking plat form.
The tray containing buffer is discarded into a waste beaker.
The tray is kept back on the work bench.
A bottle containing TBST buffer is opened and is taken from the work bench.
The TBST buffer is added to the tray containing PVDF membrane.
The TBST buffer is kept back to the work bench and is closed.
The tray is closed and is taken from the work bench.
The tray is placed on the shaking plat form and is shaken for 5 minutes.
notext
After 5 minutes, the tray is opened and is taken from the shaking plat form.
The tray containing TBST buffer is transferred into a waste beaker.
The tray is kept back on the work bench.
A 5ml pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
And the pipette pump is inserted into it.
A bottle containing 5% BSA in TBST is opened pipetted out 5%BSA solution and the bottle is closed.
5 ml of 5% BSA in TBST solution is transferred to the membrane containing tray.
A 0.5-10 microliter pipette is taken from the rack.
The value of the micropipette is adjusted to 5microliters.
A fresh tip is inserted into the micropipette.
The primary antibody (Anti GFP) containing vial is taken from the ice box.
The primary antibody containing tube is opened, pipette out 5microliters of primary antibody and the vial is closed.
The vial is kept back to the rack.
The 5 microliters of primary antibody to the tray containing buffer and the membrane. The tray is closed and is taken from the work bench.
The incubator is opened and place the tray on the shaking incubator arranged inside the incubator. The incubator is closed and is incubated overnight at 4°C on the shaking platform.
After the overnight incubation, the switched off the shaking incubator and the tray is taken from it.
The tray is opened.
A 50 ml screw cap tube is taken from the rack.
The tray containing solution is transferred into the tube. The tube is closed and is sealed.
The marker pen is taken from the work bench.
The tube is labeled as “Primary antibody and date”.
The labeled tube is kept on the rack and the tube with rack is taken from the work bench.
The 4°C refrigerator is opened; the tube with rack is placed in it for further uses and is closed.
A bottle containing the TBST buffer is opened and is taken from the work bench.
The TBST buffer is added to the tray containing PVDF membrane.
The TBST buffer is kept back to the work bench and is closed.
The tray is closed and is taken from the work bench.
The tray is placed on the shaking plat form and is shaken for 5 minutes.
notext
After 5 minutes, the tray is opened and is taken from the shaking plat form.
The solution is discarded into the waste beaker.
A bottle containing 5% BSA in TBST is opened pipetted out 5ml of 5%BSA solution and the bottle is closed.
5 ml of 5% BSA in TBST solution is transferred to the membrane containing tray.
The 4°C refrigerator is opened, the secondary antibody (anti mouse) containing vial is taken from it and is closed.
The secondary antibody (anti mouse) containing vial is taken from the rack.
The secondary antibody containing vial is covered with aluminum foil.
And is placed in the icebox.
A 0.5-10 microliters pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 1 microliter.
The tip box is opened and a fresh tip is inserted into the pipette. After that the tip box is closed.
The secondary antibody (Anti-mouse Antibody) containing vial is taken from the ice box.
The vial is opened and 1 microliter secondary antibody is pipetted out from it. After that the vial is closed and replaced into the rack.
The vial is opened and 1 microliter secondary antibody is pipetted out from it. After that the vial is closed and replaced into the rack.
1microliter of secondary antibody is transferred into the membrane containing tray and mixed it. After that the tray is closed.
A piece of aluminum foil is cut from the foil roll.
The PVDF membrane containing tray is wrapped using aluminum foil.
The primary antibody is taken from the ice box and placed into the rack. After that the rack is taken from the work bench.
The 4ºC refrigerator is opened.
The antibodies containing rack is placed in the refrigerator for storage. After that the door is closed.
The PVDF membrane containg tray is taken from the work bench.
The PVDF membrane containing tray is placed on the shaking plat form and is shaken for 2hours.
After 2hours, the shaker is switched off and the tray is taken from the shaking plat form.
The aluminum foil and the lid are removed from the tray.
The solution is discarded into the waste beaker.
notext
The TBST buffer containing bottle is opened and is taken from the table.
The TBST buffer is added to the tray containing PVDF membrane.
The shaker is switched on and is shaken for 5 minutes.
After5 minutes, the shaker is switched off and the tray is taken from the shaking plat form.
The solution is discarded into the waste beaker.
The tray is placed on the shaking plat form and the tray is closed.
Click on the button, “Detection”.
A 5 ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
5ml pipette is connected to the pipette pump.
A bottle containing hydrogen peroxide solution is opened and 5ml solution is pipette out from it. After that the bottle is closed.
A fresh tray having silver lid is opened and transfers the 5ml solution into it.
A 5 ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
5ml pipette is connected to the pipette pump.
A bottle containing Alpha luminol solution is opened and 5ml solution is pipette out from it. After that the bottle is closed.
Transfer the 5ml alpha luminol solution into the tray containing hydrogen peroxide solution (ECL solution).
The lid of the membrane containg tray is opened and the PVDF membrane is taken from it using a forceps.
The PVDF membrane is placed into the tray containing ECL solution. After that the tray is closed and kept it for 3-5 minutes at room temperature.
The tray containing membrane is taken and shake it. After that it is replaced into the work bench.
A tissue paper is taken from the tissue paper box.
The tissue paper is placed into the work bench.
The membrane tray is opened and the PVDF membrane is taken from the tray.
The PVDF membrane is placed on the tissue paper for wick off the excess solution.
The PVDF membrane is placed on the plastic wrap and plastic wrap is closed. After that gently roll out above the surface of the plastic wrap using a blotting roller.
The gel documentation system is opened and placed the membrane inside it. After that the door is closed.
Switch is on in the EPL button in the gel documentation system.
The protein bands in the membrane are observed through the gel documentation system.
